intro: Onobrychis shahpurensis, commonly known as the Shahpūr bursaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in bur-like pods, which aid in seed dispersal by attaching to the fur of animals. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
